pullRequest.body:
In `Mathlib/RingTheory/Localization/FractionRing.lean`:

- `IsFractionRing.closure_range_algebraMap`: if `A` is a ring with fraction field `K`, then the subfield of `K` generated by the image of `algebraMap A K` is equal to the whole field `K`.
- `IsFractionRing.ringHom_fieldRange_eq_of_comp_eq[_of_range_eq]`: if `A` is a ring with fraction field `K`, `L` is a field, `g : A ‚Üí+* L` lifts to `f : K ‚Üí+* L`, then the image of `f` is the field generated by the image of `g`.

In `Mathlib/FieldTheory/Adjoin.lean`:

- `IsFractionRing.algHom_fieldRange_eq_of_comp_eq[_of_range_eq]`: if `F` is a field, `A` is an `F`-algebra with fraction field `K`, `L` is a field, `g : A ‚Üí‚Çê[F] L` lifts to `f : K ‚Üí‚Çê[F] L`, `s` is a set such that the image of `g` is the subalgebra generated by `s`, then the image of `f` is the intermediate field generated by `s`. Note: this does not require `IsScalarTower F A K`.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by alreadydone.

Thanks!

bors merge

Continued from https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18648#discussion_r1838586450:
I mean that if you add
```
theorem closure_range_algebraMap : Subfield.closure (Set.range (algebraMap A K)) = ‚ä§ :=
  top_unique fun z _ ‚Ü¶ by
    obtain ‚ü®x, y, hy, rfl‚ü© := div_surjective (A := A) z
    apply div_mem <;> exact Subfield.subset_closure ‚ü®_, rfl‚ü©
```
after `div_surjective` (need to import Subfield.Basic, +2 transitive imports) then the following works:
```suggestion
theorem ringHom_fieldRange_eq_of_comp_eq
    (h : RingHom.comp f (algebraMap A K) = g) :
    f.fieldRange = Subfield.closure g.range := by
  rw [f.fieldRange_eq_map, ‚Üê IsFractionRing.closure_range_algebraMap (A := A),
    f.map_field_closure, ‚Üê Set.range_comp, ‚Üê f.coe_comp, h, g.coe_range]
```
Thank you very much! I'll study it next day.
Good observation! Added.
Putting it in this file means people will need ~30 more transitive imports to use it. But not adding imports (even just 2) to an existing file is also nice ...

> Putting it in this file means people will need ~30 more transitive imports to use it. But not adding imports (even just 2) to an existing file is also nice ...

What's your suggestion on the file? It seems that `Subfield` is lightweight, while `IntermediateField` is heavy... So it's possible to move 3 results on `Subfield` to earlier files, by adding a little bit more imports to that file.

In application I need to use `IntermediateField` version, though.

Yeah, I only suggested to put `closure_range_algebraMap` after `div_surjective` (need to import Subfield.Basic, +2 transitive imports), but the other two results could go there as well. I'd approve if it's just 2-3 import increase.

I found that `Mathlib.FieldTheory.Adjoin` already imports `IsFractionRing`. So these `AlgHom` version can be moved to that file üòÇ and we don't need to introduce a new file anymore. Do you think it's a good idea?

Perhaps all of these 5 results should go that file? In this way we don't need any additional imports...
Yeah, let's move the remaining two results to FieldTheory/Adjoin. It's natural since they are about `IntermediateField.adjoin`.
Done.
I am a little concerned about this new import. Maybe we can create a new file?
See the comment here: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18868#issuecomment-2472913388
Note that the new import is `Mathlib.Algebra.Field.Subfield.Basic`. The `Mathlib.RingTheory.SimpleRing.Basic` is just reordered alphabetically.
Ah ok!

pullRequest.title: feat: add some result on `IsFractionRing` and `fieldRange`
